subject: Ethics
title: Addiction as Disease
description: A quick, practical guide to Addiction as Disease.

hook.text: A heroin user relapses for the tenth time. Is he making bad choices, or is his brain making them for him?

buildup.text: The disease model says addiction hijacks the brain's reward systemâ€”it's not a moral failing but a medical condition.

discovery.text: Brain scans show addicts have altered dopamine circuits. Willpower alone can't easily override changed neurology.

twist.text: Critics argue calling it a disease removes responsibility. If it's a brain disease, is any bad habit a disease too?

climax.text: How we label addiction shapes treatment. Disease means hospitals. Moral failing means prisons.

punchline.text: The label decides: patient or criminal. Science or shame.

quiz.question: How does labeling addiction as a 'disease' change how society responds to it?
options: It means addicts are treated in hospitals instead of punished in prisons
It has no practical effect on treatment approaches
It automatically cures addiction through medical intervention
